div.p: This implementation guide provides the decision logic for a patient-facing FHIR-based Clinical Decision Support (CDS) tool developed at Oregon Health & Science University (OHSU) for the treatment of High Blood Pressure (Hypertension). This work was funded by the Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality (AHRQ) under a two-year U18 grant.
div.a: Research summary and one-page project overview
div.p: This implementation guide was developed to identify commonalities between clinical practice guidelines (CPG) for hypertension treatment. Based on these guidelines, and with input from expert collaborators and from surveys and interviews of primary care providers and hypertensive patients, we developed the decision logic for this CDS tool. Our goal in developing this tool is to improve patient outcomes by improving adherence to hypertension CPGs, facilitating patient education about hypertension, improving shared decision making by providing CPG-adherent treatment recommendations, and by incorporating patient preferences into the decision logic.

This implementation guide utilizes the Clinical Quality Language (CQL) development language. This is a human readable HL7 authoring language designed to facilitate harmonizing standards used for electronic clinical quality measures (eCQMs) and CDS. Each of the component parts is represented by a CQL artifact that checks entered data against value sets for hypertension and related conditions to select which treatment recommendations should be provided to end-users, based on identified patient preferences and patient context.

- The main sections of this IG are:
- Diagnosis
- Screening
- Non-Pharmacologic Treatment
- Pharmacologic Treatment
- Adverse Event Response
